com.google.android.glass.TMM

Class AudioCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.glass.TMM.TMMCard
      • com.google.android.glass.TMM.AudioCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TMMCard>

    public class AudioCard
extends TMMCard
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Class AudioCard. This card contains information representing a single card in the TellMeMore app. This card is used to present context-relevant audio information to the user, usually related to what they are learning about at that time.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    atm011
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioCard

        public AudioCard(int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String path,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new audio card. This is the 'minimal' constructor for this class, requiring the least amount of information.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        path - The path to the audio file to play if the user chooses to interact with this card. The supported file formats are those supported by Android's class MediaPlayer
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • AudioCard

        public AudioCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 int length,
                 java.lang.String backgroundPath,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new audio card without a specific audio source file.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        length - The length of the audio clip in milliseconds. Could be used for the UI.
        backgroundPath - The path of an image to use as the background to the audio player. If no background is specified the system defaults to a black background.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • AudioCard

        public AudioCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String backgroundPath,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new audio card without a specific audio source file or a length of that file.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        backgroundPath - The path of an image to use as the background to the audio player. If no background is specified the system defaults to a black background.
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • AudioCard

        public AudioCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 int length,
                 java.lang.String backgroundPath,
                 java.lang.String contentPath,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new audio card using the most commonly available attributes.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        length - The length of the audio clip in milliseconds. Could be used for the UI.
        backgroundPath - The path of an image to use as the background to the audio player. If no background is specified the system defaults to a black background.
        contentPath - The path to the audio file to play if the user chooses to interact with this card. The supported file formats are those supported by Android's class MediaPlayer
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

      • AudioCard

        public AudioCard(java.lang.String id,
                 int priority,
                 java.lang.String cardTitle,
                 java.lang.String backgroundPath,
                 java.lang.String contentPath,
                 Server source)
        Instantiates a new audio card.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        backgroundPath - The path of an image to use as the background to the audio player. If no background is specified the system defaults to a black background.
        contentPath - The path to the audio file to play if the user chooses to interact with this card. The supported file formats are those supported by Android's class MediaPlayer
        source - Information about the Server that this audio card originated from.

        public void setNumPlays(int numPlays)
        Sets the number of times that this clip has been played for this Audiocard object.
        Parameters:

      • getLengthMillis

        public int getLengthMillis()
        Gets the length of the audio clip in milliseconds. Could be used for the UI.
        Returns:
        The length of the audio clip in milliseconds.

      • hasBackground

        public boolean hasBackground()
        Checks if this AudioCard contains a background image to be displayed to the user.
        Returns:
        true, if there is a non-null background image to be displayed to the user.

      • hasAudio

        public boolean hasAudio()
        Checks if this AudioCard contains an audioclip that the user can listen to/interact with.
        Returns:
        true, if there is a non-null audio clip contained by this card.

      • setLengthMillis

        public void setLengthMillis(int lengthMillis)
        Sets the length of the audioclip contained in this card.
        Parameters:
        lengthMillis - The new length of the clip (in milliseconds) to be set.

        Gets the background image path, if it exists.
        Returns:
        A string contain the filesystem path to the background image if it exists.

      • setBackgroundPath

        public void setBackgroundPath(java.lang.String backgroundPath)
        Sets the path to the background image for this card.
        Parameters:
        backgroundPath - the new background path

      • getAudioClipPath

        public java.lang.String getAudioClipPath()
        Gets the audio clip path of the target file to play.
        Returns:

      • setAudioClip

        public void setAudioClip(java.lang.String audioClipPath)
        Sets the path to the audio file to play when the user interacts with this card.
        Parameters:
        audioClipPath - The path of the new audio file to associate with this card.

      • getAudioClipName

        public java.lang.String getAudioClipName()
        Gets the name of the audio file to play when the user interacts with this card.
        Returns:
        The path of the audio file associated with this card.

      • setAudioClipName

        private void setAudioClipName(java.lang.String audioClipName)
        Sets the audio clip name. Users should not call this method directly to maintain consistency between the audio clip path and its filename.
        Parameters:
        audioClipName - The name of the audio clip to set.

      • getBackground_name

        public java.lang.String getBackground_name()
        Gets the name of the image file used for the background of the audio player.
        Returns:
        The name of the background image file.

      • setBackground_name

        private void setBackground_name(java.lang.String background_name)
        Sets the background_name. Users should not call this method directly to maintain consistency between the background image path and its filename.
        Parameters:
        background_name - The new name of the background image file to set.
